snippet: Days after a federal judge blocked a Texas law that threatened to shut down many of the state’s abortion clinics, an appeals court said the rule should take effect while the case goes forward.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit, in New Orleans, reverses decision by federal judge blocking new Texas law that threatened to shut down many of state's abortion clinics; says rule should take effect while case goes forward.
lead_paragraph: Days after a federal judge blocked a Texas law that threatened to shut down many of the state’s abortion clinics, an appeals court said the rule should take effect while the case goes forward.

headline.main: In Reversal, Court Allows Texas Law on Abortion
headline.print_headline: In Reversal, Court Allows Texas Law On Abortion
